programme.title: Negroes With Guns: Rob Williams & Black Power
programme.desc: It tells the dramatic story of Rob Williams, the often-forgotten civil rights leader who urged Black Americans to arm themselves against violent racists.

programme.title: House of Saints
programme.desc: A study of retribution and atonement, House of Saints follows Reggie Scott â€“ a jazz lover and former convict released after serving a thirty-two year sentence for murder â€“ as he returns to his childhood home, a monument to the influence of his well-to-do influential family of doctors and educators.

programme.title: THE BILL
programme.desc: Lena and ten other women could not be more excited to celebrate Barbie's 35th birthday. When an unexpectedly huge bill arrives, the happy birthday dissolves into drama.

programme.title: TITLE VII
programme.desc: The CEO of Sanger International, an IT consulting firm, is powerful and successful Hillary Kelsey. Kelsey is a black woman with no black employees and no one can figure out whyâ€”until Darryl Montgomery, her 9:30 am interview, enters the firm.

programme.title: ARISTIDE
programme.desc: Examines the 2004 coup in Haiti that lead to the removal of President Jean-Bertrand Aristide

programme.title: PEACE OF QUEV
programme.desc: Peace of Quev is a portrait of Brooklyn artist Quindell Evans, whose music and poetry uplift his community and those around him.

programme.title: BE A FISH
programme.desc: Determined, 9 year-old Taylor buys a fish in order to practice how to swim for her â€śBig Day.â€ť

programme.title: CLOSURE
programme.desc: Angela, an African-American raised by a Caucasian couple in a large, multiracial family in Washington State, comes face to face with her birth mother for the first time, and meets family members who had never known she was even born â€“ including her birth father.

programme.title: ANGELA
programme.desc: A Cuban immigrant tries to find her place in New York City.

programme.title: Nothing But The Truth
programme.desc: Joseph, a troubled young gang member who participated in the countrywide violence is drawn to Anne and her farm seemingly in search of redemption. Both he and Anne need something that only the other can give to allow them to shed the painful memories of their past and move on â€“ but will either of them find it?

programme.title: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump At The Sun
programme.desc: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump at the Sun is a moving interpretation of Zora Neale Hurston's life and career.

programme.title: AN UNCOMMON WOMAN
programme.desc: Mina is tired of her husband's infidelity and decides to take a drastic decision: She takes a second husband. Based on his conversations with women involved in polygamist relationships, filmmaker Abdoulaye Dao illustrates - to very funny effects - the daily life of two persons - in this case two men - who share a spouse.

programme.title: AFRO GERMANY
programme.desc: In Afro Germany, Jana Pareigis takes us on a trip through Germany from its colonial past up to the present day, visiting other Black Germans to talk about their experiences

programme.title: MONA
programme.desc: In June 1973, a week before the Portuguese Prime Minister, Dr Ribeiro, is due to arrive in London for a state visit, protests all over the city are growing due to Portugal's harsh foreign policy in its colony of Mozambique.

programme.title: Pahokee - Skip Day
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: BlackOWND Series - 1 KoriH
programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: Pahokee - The Send Off

programme.title: Jazree's Court
programme.desc: Jazree's father was sent to jail for 7 years due to possession of an unloaded firearm. Jazree, who was close to her father, talks about the implication of growing up with him behind bars. Putting a person in jail doesn't just affect that individualâ€“it affects their entire family and community.

programme.title: The Brink
programme.desc: The Brink centers around two stranded survivors in an endless wasteland who clash as they unravel the truth of what led them there.

programme.title: What's More Important Episode 1
programme.desc: R.C. struggles in his job hunting due to the lack of one crucial skill while desperately attempting to pay off his debts.'

programme.title: Wilmington on Fire
programme.desc: On November 10, an armed mob of white supremacists opened fire on African American neighborhoods, slaughtering hundreds and driving thousands out of the city for good.
